pull.title: trivial: fix various pyflakes/vulture warnings
pull.body: I am trying to learn my way around the Bitcoin code, and I decided to try to fix some minor errors reported by pyflakes/vulture. Most of these are just getting rid of unused variables.

events.body:
Concept ACK. Thanks for doing these uncontroversial cleanups.

Please note that the changes in this PR are partly overlapping with #10781. Would you mind reviewing #10781?

A minor nit: The changes made to `socks5.py` are whitespace only changes. According to the [developer notes](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/developer-notes.md) of the projects these changes should probably be excluded.

Looks good. Agree that #10781 should go in first and this be rebased on top of it.

Thanks for your contribution!
Closing for now due to inactivity. Let me know to reopen.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -63,7 +63,7 @@ def run_test(self):
         addr2Obj = self.nodes[2].validateaddress(addr2)
 
         mSigObj = self.nodes[2].addmultisigaddress(2, [addr1Obj['pubkey'], addr2Obj['pubkey']])
-        mSigObjValid = self.nodes[2].validateaddress(mSigObj)
+        assert self.nodes[2].validateaddress(mSigObj)
comments.body: IIRC, this returns a dict and you'd need to assert on the value of the "isvalid" key.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -14,8 +14,7 @@
 import sys
 bchr = chr
 bord = ord
-if sys.version > '3':
-    long = int
+if sys.version_info.major == 3:
comments.body: functional tests always run in Python 3. I think you can remove support for 2 entirely from this module.

-        with open(self.alert_filename, 'w', encoding='utf8') as _:
+        with open(self.alert_filename, 'w', encoding='utf8'):
